results:
Based on the search results, I can provide information about Helena Modrzejewska's performance of "Dama Kameliowa" (The Lady of the Camellias) in Polish theaters during the 19th century:

Helena Modrzejewska gained recognition for her portrayal of Małgorzata Gauthier in "Dama kameliowa" by Alexandre Dumas fils. She was the first actress to present "The Lady of the Camellias" to Polish audiences in 1879, and she performed this role throughout her entire life, until her old age.

Helena Modrzejewska (1840-1909) was considered the most outstanding Polish actress. She began her career in 1861 in Bochnia with an amateur troupe that soon became professional, and performed in many Galician cities including Lvov (1862-63) and Krakow (1865-69), before moving to Warsaw where she performed at the WTR theater from 1869-76.

During her time in Warsaw, thanks to her position supported by her friendship with Maria Kalergis (wife of WTR president Sergius Muchanow), she had significant influence on the development of Warsaw theater, and her efforts led to the staging of works by Juliusz Słowacki and William Shakespeare's dramas in translations from the original.

During her 50-year career on stage, Modrzejewska was recognized as one of the greatest interpreters of Shakespeare's works, playing a total of 260 roles in six thousand performances. Her most notable roles included: Ophelia, Julia, Lady Macbeth, Maria Stuart, Dama Kameliowa, Adrianne Lecouvreur, and Idalia.

The role of "Dama Kameliowa" became one of her signature performances and remained in her repertoire throughout her career, demonstrating the lasting impact of this character on Polish theater in the 19th century.
